sense.name: a physical structure which connects separate places by overarching an obstacle
sense.examples: Several bridges over the river fell down during the big earthquake. That bridge is an overpass of the north-south freeway. Erosion left a natural land bridge of sandstone between the two rock outcrops. The boy was injured playing on a railroad bridge.

sense.name: anything which serves the role of linking separate things
sense.commentary: BRIDGE[+relation][+role][+connector] Note: this is an abstract notion of linkage, not a concrete object that connects things
sense.examples: A committee was formed to create a bridge between the rival political factions. His idea provides the major conceptual bridge between the fields of micro and macro-evolutionary study. That architectural style is the bridge between early and late neoclassical structure. She's burned a lot of bridges at work through her conduct. (metaphoric extension)

sense.name: the hard upper part of the human nose
sense.examples: A fast ball hit John on the bridge of his nose and cracked it. She admired the high bridge of the aristocrat's nose. The surgeon reconstructed the bridge of the patient's nose after the accident.

sense.name: a card game
sense.examples: We need a fourth person in order to play bridge. Mary is having a bridge party at her house this evening. In contract bridge, one player is the dummy.

sense.name: a wooden support on a stringed musical instrument
sense.examples: What kind of wood is the bridge of your violin made of? This 12-string guitar has a rather sturdy bridge.

sense.name: a partial denture
sense.commentary: BRIDGE[+entity][+artifact][+support][+denture][+partial] Note: implies there are existing teeth on either side of the bridge
sense.examples: John has a lower bridge to replace two lost teeth. The dentist told the patient that a new bridge would cost about a thousand dollars.

sense.name: link that connects lenses of a pair of spectacles
sense.examples: The optician adjusted the bridge of Mary's new wireframe glasses. These sunglasses have a special nose bridge for comfort.

sense.name: upper deck of a vessel which is the command center
sense.examples: The captain of the cruise ship gave some of the passengers a tour of the bridge. Who is manning the bridge while the captain and first officer are off the ship?

sense.name: a type of electronic circuit
sense.examples: Power supplies often use a bridge circuit. All three types of bridge circuits compare the output of two potentiometers sharing a common source.

sense.name: a transitional musical passage
sense.examples: I can play the main melody of the song, but the bridge is a little tricky. There's 12 bars in a major key, but the bridge switches into a minor one.

sense.name: a wooden support for a pool cue
sense.examples: John used a bridge to support his pool cue for the tricky shot. I think the bridge is hanging under the pool table.

sense.name: a network device that manages data transfer
sense.examples: This chapter of the book describes how bridges, routers and repeaters are used in networks. Network bridges operate at a lower level of the network than routers.
